The current time is 2025-12-28 22:40:41.\nYour team member:\nMike: Team Leader, Manage a team to assist users\nAlice: Product Manager, Create a Product Requirement Document or market research/competitive product research.\nBob: Architect, design a concise, usable, complete software system. output the system design.\nAlex: Engineer, Take on game, app, web development and deployment.\nDavid: DataAnalyst, Take on any data-related tasks, such as data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, web browsing, web scraping, web searching, terminal operation, document QA & analysis, etc.\n\n\nYour role is to determine the appropriate response category for the given request.\n\n# Response Categories\n## QUICK: \nFor straightforward questions or requests that can be answered directly. This includes common-sense inquiries, legal or logical questions, basic math, short coding tasks, multiple-choice questions, greetings, casual chat, daily planning, and inquiries about you or your team.\n\n## SEARCH\nFor queries that require retrieving up-to-date or detailed information. This includes time-sensitive or location-specific questions like current events or weather. Use this only if the information isn\'t readily available.\nIf a file or link is provided, you don\'t need to search for additional information.\n\n## TASK\nFor requests that involve tool utilizations, computer operations, multiple steps or detailed instructions. Examples include software development, project planning, or any task that requires tool usage.\n\n## AMBIGUOUS\nFor requests that are unclear, lack sufficient detail, or are outside the system\'s capabilities. Common characteristics of AMBIGUOUS requests:\n\n- Incomplete Information: Requests that imply complex tasks but lack critical details  (e.g., "Redesign this logo" without specifying design requirements).\n- Vagueness: Broad, unspecified, or unclear requests that make it difficult to provide a precise answer. \n- Unrealistic Scope: Overly broad requests that are impossible to address meaningfully in a single response (e.g., "Tell me everything about...").\n- Missing files: Requests that refer to specific documents, images, or data without providing them for reference. (when providing a file, website, or data, either the content, link, or path **must** be included)\n\n**Note:** Before categorizing a request as TASK:\n1. Consider whether the user has provided sufficient information to proceed with the task. If the request is complex but lacks essential details or the mentioned files\' content or path, it should fall under AMBIGUOUS.\n2. If the request is a "how-to" question that asks for a general plan, approach or strategy, it should be categorized as QUICK.\n\n\n# Example\n\n1. Request: "How do I design an online document editing platform that supports real-time collaboration?"\nThought: This is a direct query about platform design, answerable without additional resources. \nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n2. Request: "What\'s the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning in machine learning?"\nThought: This is a general knowledge question that can be answered concisely. \nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n3. Request: "Please help me write a learning plan for Python web crawlers"\nThought: Writing a learning plan is a daily planning task that can be answered directly.\nResponse Category: QUICK.\n\n4. Request: "Can you help me find the latest research papers on deep learning?"\nThought: The user needs current research, requiring a search for the most recent sources. \nResponse Category: SEARCH.\n\n5. Request: "Build a personal website that runs the Game of Life simulation."\nThought: This is a detailed software development task that requires multiple steps. \nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n6. Request: "Summarize this document for me."\nThought: The request mentions summarizing a document but doesn\'t provide the path or content of the document, making it impossible to fulfill. \nResponse Category: AMBIGUOUS.\n\n7. Request: "Summarize this document for me \'/data/path/docmument.pdf\'." \nThought: The request mentions summarizing a document and has provided the path to the document. It can be done by reading the document using a tool then summarizing it.\nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n8. Request: "Optimize this process." \nThought: The request is vague and lacks specifics, requiring clarification on the process to optimize.\nResponse Category: AMBIGUOUS.\n\n9. Request: "Change the color of the text to blue in styles.css, add a new button in web page, delete the old background image."\nThought: The request is an incremental development task that requires modifying one or more files.\nResponse Category: TASK.\n\n'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': '[Message] from User to Mike: \n\nBased on the following use case, write a complete program in Java. DONT omit any necessary info such as path, link, environment, programming language, framework, requirement, constraint from original content to team members because you are their sole info source.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to the user directly, DON\'T ask your team members.\nPay close attention to messages from team members. If a team member has finished a task, do not ask them to repeat it; instead, mark the current task as completed.\nNote:\n1. If the requirement is a pure DATA-RELATED requirement, such as web browsing, web scraping, web searching, web imitation, data science, data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, text-to-image etc. DON\'T decompose it, assign a single task with the original user requirement as instruction directly to Data Analyst.\n2. If the requirement is developing a software, game, app, or website, excluding the above data-related tasks, you should decompose the requirement into multiple tasks and assign them to different team members based on their expertise. The standard software development process has four steps: creating a Product Requirement Document (PRD) by the Product Manager -> writing a System Design by the Architect -> creating tasks by the Project Manager -> and coding by the Engineer. You may choose to execute any of these steps. When publishing message to Product Manager, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n2.1. If the requirement contains both DATA-RELATED part mentioned in 1 and software development part mentioned in 2, you should decompose the software development part and assign them to different team members based on their expertise, and assign the DATA-RELATED part to Data Analyst David directly.\n2.2. For software development requirement, estimate the complexity of the requirement before assignment, following the common industry practice of t-shirt sizing:\n - XS: snake game, static personal homepage, basic calculator app\n - S: Basic photo gallery, basic file upload system, basic feedback form\n - M: Offline menu ordering system, news aggregator app\n - L: Online booking system, inventory management system\n - XL: Social media platform, e-commerce app, real-time multiplayer game\n - For XS and S requirements, you don\'t need the standard software development process, you may directly ask Engineer to write the code. Otherwise, estimate if any part of the standard software development process may contribute to a better final code. If so, assign team members accordingly.\n3.1 If the task involves code review (CR) or code checking, you should assign it to Engineer.\n4. If the requirement is a common-sense, logical, or math problem, you should respond directly without assigning any task to team members.\n5. If you think the requirement is not clear or ambiguous, you should ask the user for clarification immediately. Assign tasks only after all info is clear.\n6. It is helpful for Engineer to have both the system design and the project schedule for writing the code, so include paths of both files (if available) and remind Engineer to definitely read them when publishing message to Engineer.\n7. If the requirement is writing a TRD and software framework, you should assign it to Architect. When publishing message to Architect, you should directly copy the full original user requirement.\n8. If the receiver message reads \'from {team member} to {\'<all>\'}, it indicates that someone has completed the current task. Note this in your thoughts.\n9. Do not use the \'end\' command when the current task remains unfinished; instead, use the \'finish_current_task\' command to indicate completion before switching to the next task.\n10. Do not use escape characters in json data, particularly within file paths.\n11. Analyze the capabilities of team members and assign tasks to them based on user Requirements. If the requirements ask to ignore certain tasks, follow the requirements.\n12. If the the user message is a question, use \'reply to human\' to respond to the question, and then end.\n13. Instructions and reply must be in the same language.\n14. Default technology stack is Vite, React, MUI, Tailwind CSS. Web app is the default option when developing software. If use these technology stacks, ask the engineer to delopy the web app after project completion.\n15. You are the only one who decides the programming language for the software, so the instruction must contain the programming language.\n16. Data collection and web/software development are two separate tasks. You must assign these tasks to data analysts and engineers, respectively. Replace lines from start_line to end_line (inclusive) with the new_content in the open file. All of the new_content will be entered, so makesure your indentation is formatted properly. The new_content must be a complete block of code. Example 1: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to replace line 2 and line 3 edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"new content\\", ) This will replace the second line 2 and line 3 with \\"new content\\". The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002|new content 003|contain i ``` Example 2: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to remove the line 2 and line 3. edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"\\", ) This will remove line 2 and line 3. The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002| 003|contain i ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, first_replaced_line_number: int, first_replaced_line_content: str, last_replaced_line_number: int, last_replaced_line_content: str, new_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name (str): The name of the file to edit. first_replaced_line_number (int): The line number to start the edit at, starting from 1. first_replaced_line_content (str): The content of the start replace line, according to the first_replaced_line_number. last_replaced_line_number (int): The line number to end the edit at (inclusive), starting from 1. last_replaced_line_content (str): The content of the end replace line, according to the last_replaced_line_number. new_content (str): The text to replace the current selection with, must conform to PEP8 standards. The content in the start line and end line will also be replaced."}, "find_file": {"type": "function", "description": "Finds all files with the given name in the specified directory. That is, the new content will start at the beginning of the specified line, and the existing content of that line will be moved down. This operation will NOT modify the content of the lines before or after the given line number. This function can not insert content the end of the file. Please use append_file instead, For example, if the file has the following content: ``` 001|contain g 002|contain h 003|contain i 004|contain j ``` and you call insert_content_at_line( file_name=\'file.txt\', line_number=2, insert_content=\'new line\' ) the file will be updated to: ``` 001|contain g 002|new line 003|contain h 004|contain i 005|contain j ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, line_number: int, insert_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name: (str): The name of the file to edit. line_number (int): The line number (starting from 1) to insert the content after. an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. 2025-12-28 22:42:17.233 | INFO     | metagpt.utils.cost_manager:update_cost:59 - Total running cost: $0.001 | Max budget: $3.000 | Current cost: $0.000, prompt_tokens: 2251, completion_tokens: 4017total_token: $46237.000
2025-12-28 22:42:26.381 | ERROR    | metagpt.utils.common:parse_code:291 - ```.*?\s+(.*?)\n``` not match following text:
2025-12-28 22:42:26.382 | ERROR    | metagpt.utils.common:parse_code:292 - ```
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Scanner;

/**
 * Main class for the ViewOnePage use case.
 * This program simulates an administrator viewing a student's report card.
 * It follows the sequence: select academic year -> choose class -> select student and months -> display report.
 */
public class ViewOnePage {
    
    // Scanner for user input
    private static Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
    
    // Simulated SMOS server connection
    private static SMOSServer smosServer;
    
    // Current academic year selected by user
    private static AcademicYear selectedAcademicYear;
    
    // Current class selected by user
    private static Class selectedClass;
    
    // Current student selected by user
    private static Student selectedStudent;
    
    // Selected months for the report (4 months)
    private static List<String> selectedMonths = new ArrayList<>();
    
    /**
     * Main method - entry point of the program
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("=== Student Report Card System ===");
        System.out.println("Administrator logged in successfully.");
        
        try {
            // Step 0: Initialize SMOS server connection
            initializeSMOSConnection();
            
            // Step 1: User selects academic year
            selectAcademicYear();
            
            // Step 2: System displays list of classes with "report cards" button
            displayClassesWithReportCards();
            
            // Step 3: User chooses pupil class
            choosePupilClass();
            
            // Step 4: System displays list of class students
            displayClassStudents();
            
            // Step 5: User selects student and four months
            selectStudentAndMonths();
            
            // Step 6: System displays chosen student report for selected four months
            displayStudentReport();
            
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.err.println("Error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
            e.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            // Postcondition: User stops connection to SMOS server
            stopSMOSConnection();
            scanner.close();
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 0: Initialize connection to SMOS server
     */
    private static void initializeSMOSConnection() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Initializing SMOS Server Connection ---");
        smosServer = new SMOSServer();
        smosServer.connect();
        System.out.println("Connected to SMOS server successfully.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 1: User selects academic year
     */
    private static void selectAcademicYear() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 1: Select Academic Year ---");
        
        // Get available academic years from server
        List<AcademicYear> academicYears = smosServer.getAvailableAcademicYears();
        
        if (academicYears.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No academic years available.");
            System.exit(1);
        }
        
        // Display available academic years
        System.out.println("Available Academic Years:");
        for (int i = 0; i < academicYears.size(); i++) {
            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + academicYears.get(i).getYearRange());
        }
        
        // Get user selection with validation
        int choice = 0;
        while (choice < 1 || choice > academicYears.size()) {
            System.out.print("Enter your choice (1-" + academicYears.size() + "): ");
            try {
                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());
                if (choice < 1 || choice > academicYears.size()) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");
                }
            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");
            }
        }
        
        selectedAcademicYear = academicYears.get(choice - 1);
        System.out.println("Selected academic year: " + selectedAcademicYear.getYearRange());
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 2: System displays list of classes with "report cards" button
     */
    private static void displayClassesWithReportCards() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 2: Available Classes ---");
        
        // Get classes for selected academic year
        List<Class> classes = smosServer.getClassesForAcademicYear(selectedAcademicYear);
        
        if (classes.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No classes available for the selected academic year.");
            System.exit(1);
        }
        
        // Display classes with "report cards" button indicator
        System.out.println("Classes with report cards available:");
        for (int i = 0; i < classes.size(); i++) {
            Class cls = classes.get(i);
            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + cls.getClassName() + 
                             " (Grade: " + cls.getGradeLevel() + 
                             ") - [REPORT CARDS]");
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 3: User chooses pupil class
     */
    private static void choosePupilClass() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 3: Choose Pupil Class ---");
        
        // Get classes for selected academic year
        List<Class> classes = smosServer.getClassesForAcademicYear(selectedAcademicYear);
        
        // Get user selection with validation
        int choice = 0;
        while (choice < 1 || choice > classes.size()) {
            System.out.print("Enter class number (1-" + classes.size() + "): ");
            try {
                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());
                if (choice < 1 || choice > classes.size()) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");
                }
            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");
            }
        }
        
        selectedClass = classes.get(choice - 1);
        System.out.println("Selected class: " + selectedClass.getClassName());
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 4: System displays list of class students
     */
    private static void displayClassStudents() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 4: Students in " + selectedClass.getClassName() + " ---");
        
        // Get students for selected class
        List<Student> students = smosServer.getStudentsForClass(selectedClass);
        
        if (students.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No students found in this class.");
            System.exit(1);
        }
        
        // Display students
        System.out.println("Students in class:");
        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {
            Student student = students.get(i);
            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + student.getFullName() + 
                             " (ID: " + student.getStudentId() + ")");
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 5: User selects student and four months
     */
    private static void selectStudentAndMonths() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 5: Select Student and Four Months ---");
        
        // Get students for selected class
        List<Student> students = smosServer.getStudentsForClass(selectedClass);
        
        // Select student
        int studentChoice = 0;
        while (studentChoice < 1 || studentChoice > students.size()) {
            System.out.print("Enter student number (1-" + students.size() + "): ");
            try {
                studentChoice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());
                if (studentChoice < 1 || studentChoice > students.size()) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");
                }
            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");
            }
        }
        
        selectedStudent = students.get(studentChoice - 1);
        System.out.println("Selected student: " + selectedStudent.getFullName());
        
        // Select four months
        System.out.println("\nSelect four months for the report:");
        List<String> availableMonths = smosServer.getAvailableMonths(selectedAcademicYear, selectedClass);
        
        if (availableMonths.size() < 4) {
            System.out.println("Warning: Only " + availableMonths.size() + " months available.");
        }
        
        System.out.println("Available months: " + String.join(", ", availableMonths));
        
        selectedMonths.clear();
        for (int i = 0; i < 4 && i < availableMonths.size(); i++) {
            String month;
            do {
                System.out.print("Enter month " + (i + 1) + " (from available months): ");
                month = scanner.nextLine().trim();
                
                if (!availableMonths.contains(month)) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid month. Please choose from available months.");
                } else if (selectedMonths.contains(month)) {
                    System.out.println("Month already selected. Please choose a different month.");
                } else {
                    selectedMonths.add(month);
                    break;
                }
            } while (true);
        }
        
        System.out.println("Selected months: " + String.join(", ", selectedMonths));
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 6: System displays chosen student report for selected four months
     */
    private static void displayStudentReport() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 6: Student Report Card ---");
        System.out.println("=====================================");
        
        // Get report card for selected student and months
        ReportCard reportCard = smosServer.getReportCard(selectedStudent, selectedAcademicYear, selectedMonths);
        
        if (reportCard == null) {
            System.out.println("No report card found for the selected criteria.");
            return;
        }
        
        // Display report card
        System.out.println("STUDENT REPORT CARD");
        System.out.println("====================");
        System.out.println("Student: " + reportCard.getStudentName());
        System.out.println("Class: " + reportCard.getClassName());
        System.out.println("Academic Year: " + reportCard.getAcademicYear());
        System.out.println("Report Period: " + String.join(", ", reportCard.getMonths()));
        System.out.println();
        
        System.out.println("ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE");
        System.out.println("--------------------");
        Map<String, String> grades = reportCard.getGrades();
        if (grades.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No grades available.");
        } else {
            for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : grades.entrySet()) {
                System.out.println(entry.getKey() + ": " + entry.getValue());
            }
        }
        
        System.out.println();
        System.out.println("ATTENDANCE");
        System.out.println("----------");
        System.out.println("Days Present: " + reportCard.getDaysPresent());
        System.out.println("Days Absent: " + reportCard.getDaysAbsent());
        System.out.println("Attendance Rate: " + reportCard.getAttendanceRate() + "%");
        
        System.out.println();
        System.out.println("TEACHER COMMENTS");
        System.out.println("----------------");
        System.out.println(reportCard.getTeacherComments());
        
        System.out.println();
        System.out.println("OVERALL PERFORMANCE");
        System.out.println("-------------------");
        System.out.println("Overall Grade: " + reportCard.getOverallGrade());
        System.out.println("Status: " + reportCard.getPerformanceStatus());
        
        System.out.println("\n=====================================");
        System.out.println("End of Report Card");
    }
    
    /**
     * Postcondition: Stop connection to SMOS server
     */
    private static void stopSMOSConnection() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Stopping SMOS Server Connection ---");
        if (smosServer != null) {
            smosServer.disconnect();
            System.out.println("Disconnected from SMOS server.");
        }
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing a student
 */
class Student {
    private String studentId;
    private String firstName;
    private String lastName;
    
    public Student(String studentId, String firstName, String lastName) {
        this.studentId = studentId;
        this.firstName = firstName;
        this.lastName = lastName;
    }
    
    public String getStudentId() {
        return studentId;
    }
    
    public String getFirstName() {
        return firstName;
    }
    
    public String getLastName() {
        return lastName;
    }
    
    public String getFullName() {
        return firstName + " " + lastName;
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing a school class
 */
class Class {
    private String classId;
    private String className;
    private int gradeLevel;
    private String teacherName;
    
    public Class(String classId, String className, int gradeLevel, String teacherName) {
        this.classId = classId;
        this.className = className;
        this.gradeLevel = gradeLevel;
        this.teacherName = teacherName;
    }
    
    public String getClassId() {
        return classId;
    }
    
    public String getClassName() {
        return className;
    }
    
    public int getGradeLevel() {
        return gradeLevel;
    }
    
    public String getTeacherName() {
        return teacherName;
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing an academic year
 */
class AcademicYear {
    private String yearId;
    private String startYear;
    private String endYear;
    
    public AcademicYear(String yearId, String startYear, String endYear) {
        this.yearId = yearId;
        this.startYear = startYear;
        this.endYear = endYear;
    }
    
    public String getYearId() {
        return yearId;
    }
    
    public String getStartYear() {
        return startYear;
    }
    
    public String getEndYear() {
        return endYear;
    }
    
    public String getYearRange() {
        return startYear + "-" + endYear;
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing a report card
 */
class ReportCard {
    private String studentName;
    private String className;
    private String academicYear;
    private List<String> months;
    private Map<String, String> grades;
    private int daysPresent;
    private int daysAbsent;
    private String teacherComments;
    private String overallGrade;
    private String performanceStatus;
    
    public ReportCard(String studentName, String className, String academicYear, 
                     List<String> months, Map<String, String> grades,
                     int daysPresent, int daysAbsent, String teacherComments,
                     String overallGrade, String performanceStatus) {
        this.studentName = studentName;
        this.className = className;
        this.academicYear = academicYear;
        this.months = months;
        this.grades = grades;
        this.daysPresent = daysPresent;
        this.daysAbsent = daysAbsent;
        this.teacherComments = teacherComments;
        this.overallGrade = overallGrade;
        this.performanceStatus = performanceStatus;
    }
    
    public String getStudentName() {
        return studentName;
    }
    
    public String getClassName() {
        return className;
    }
    
    public String getAcademicYear() {
        return academicYear;
    }
    
    public List<String> getMonths() {
        return months;
    }
    
    public Map<String, String> getGrades() {
        return grades;
    }
    
    public int getDaysPresent() {
        return daysPresent;
    }
    
    public int getDaysAbsent() {
        return daysAbsent;
    }
    
    public double getAttendanceRate() {
        int totalDays = daysPresent + daysAbsent;
        return totalDays > 0 ? (double) daysPresent / totalDays * 100 : 0;
    }
    
    public String getTeacherComments() {
        return teacherComments;
    }
    
    public String getOverallGrade() {
        return overallGrade;
    }
    
    public String getPerformanceStatus() {
        return performanceStatus;
    }
}

/**
 * Class simulating SMOS server connection and data retrieval
 */
class SMOSServer {
    private boolean connected = false;
    
    // Simulated data storage
    private List<AcademicYear> academicYears;
    private List<Class> classes;
    private List<Student> students;
    private Map<String, ReportCard> reportCards;
    
    public SMOSServer() {
        initializeData();
    }
    
    /**
     * Initialize simulated data
     */
    private void initializeData() {
        // Initialize academic years
        academicYears = new ArrayList<>();
        academicYears.add(new AcademicYear("AY1", "2023", "2024"));
        academicYears.add(new AcademicYear("AY2", "2022", "2023"));
        academicYears.add(new AcademicYear("AY3", "2021", "2022"));
        
        // Initialize classes
        classes = new ArrayList<>();
        classes.add(new Class("C1", "Class 10A", 10, "Mr. Smith"));
        classes.add(new Class("C2", "Class 10B", 10, "Ms. Johnson"));
        classes.add(new Class("C3", "Class 11A", 11, "Dr. Williams"));
        classes.add(new Class("C4", "Class 11B", 11, "Mrs. Brown"));
        classes.add(new Class("C5", "Class 12A", 12, "Mr. Davis"));
        
        // Initialize students
        students = new ArrayList<>();
        students.add(new Student("S101", "John", "Doe"));
        students.add(new Student("S102", "Jane", "Smith"));
        students.add(new Student("S103", "Robert", "Johnson"));
        students.add(new Student("S104", "Emily", "Williams"));
        students.add(new Student("S105", "Michael", "Brown"));
        students.add(new Student("S106", "Sarah", "Davis"));
        students.add(new Student("S107", "David", "Miller"));
        students.add(new Student("S108", "Lisa", "Wilson"));
        
        // Initialize report cards
        reportCards = new HashMap<>();
        
        // Sample report card data
        Map<String, String> grades1 = new HashMap<>();
        grades1.put("Mathematics", "A");
        grades1.put("Science", "B+");
        grades1.put("English", "A-");
        grades1.put("History", "B");
        grades1.put("Physical Education", "A");
        
        List<String> months1 = List.of("September", "October", "November", "December");
        
        ReportCard report1 = new ReportCard(
            "John Doe", "Class 10A", "2023-2024",
            months1, grades1,
            85, 5, "John has shown excellent progress in Mathematics and Physical Education. " +
                  "He participates actively in class discussions and completes assignments on time. " +
                  "Could improve focus in Science classes.",
            "A-", "Excellent"
        );
        
        reportCards.put("S101_2023-2024_Sep-Dec", report1);
        
        // More sample data could be added here
    }
    
    /**
     * Connect to SMOS server
     */
    public void connect() {
        connected = true;
    }
    
    /**
     * Disconnect from SMOS server
     */
    public void disconnect() {
        connected = false;
    }
    
    /**
     * Check if connected to server
     */
    public boolean is
2025-12-28 22:42:26.395 | INFO     | metagpt.roles.di.role_zero:_act:294 - Commands outputs: 
Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ViewOnePage_1766932840/ViewOnePage.java has been successfully created, with content:
```
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Scanner;

/**
 * Main class for the ViewOnePage use case.
 * This program simulates an administrator viewing a student's report card.
 * It follows the sequence: select academic year -> choose class -> select student and months -> display report.
 */
public class ViewOnePage {
    
    // Scanner for user input
    private static Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
    
    // Simulated SMOS server connection
    private static SMOSServer smosServer;
    
    // Current academic year selected by user
    private static AcademicYear selectedAcademicYear;
    
    // Current class selected by user
    private static Class selectedClass;
    
    // Current student selected by user
    private static Student selectedStudent;
    
    // Selected months for the report (4 months)
    private static List<String> selectedMonths = new ArrayList<>();
    
    /**
     * Main method - entry point of the program
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("=== Student Report Card System ===");
        System.out.println("Administrator logged in successfully.");
        
        try {
            // Step 0: Initialize SMOS server connection
            initializeSMOSConnection();
            
            // Step 1: User selects academic year
            selectAcademicYear();
            
            // Step 2: System displays list of classes with "report cards" button
            displayClassesWithReportCards();
            
            // Step 3: User chooses pupil class
            choosePupilClass();
            
            // Step 4: System displays list of class students
            displayClassStudents();
            
            // Step 5: User selects student and four months
            selectStudentAndMonths();
            
            // Step 6: System displays chosen student report for selected four months
            displayStudentReport();
            
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.err.println("Error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
            e.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            // Postcondition: User stops connection to SMOS server
            stopSMOSConnection();
            scanner.close();
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 0: Initialize connection to SMOS server
     */
    private static void initializeSMOSConnection() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Initializing SMOS Server Connection ---");
        smosServer = new SMOSServer();
        smosServer.connect();
        System.out.println("Connected to SMOS server successfully.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 1: User selects academic year
     */
    private static void selectAcademicYear() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 1: Select Academic Year ---");
        
        // Get available academic years from server
        List<AcademicYear> academicYears = smosServer.getAvailableAcademicYears();
        
        if (academicYears.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No academic years available.");
            System.exit(1);
        }
        
        // Display available academic years
        System.out.println("Available Academic Years:");
        for (int i = 0; i < academicYears.size(); i++) {
            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + academicYears.get(i).getYearRange());
        }
        
        // Get user selection with validation
        int choice = 0;
        while (choice < 1 || choice > academicYears.size()) {
            System.out.print("Enter your choice (1-" + academicYears.size() + "): ");
            try {
                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());
                if (choice < 1 || choice > academicYears.size()) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");
                }
            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");
            }
        }
        
        selectedAcademicYear = academicYears.get(choice - 1);
        System.out.println("Selected academic year: " + selectedAcademicYear.getYearRange());
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 2: System displays list of classes with "report cards" button
     */
    private static void displayClassesWithReportCards() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 2: Available Classes ---");
        
        // Get classes for selected academic year
        List<Class> classes = smosServer.getClassesForAcademicYear(selectedAcademicYear);
        
        if (classes.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No classes available for the selected academic year.");
            System.exit(1);
        }
        
        // Display classes with "report cards" button indicator
        System.out.println("Classes with report cards available:");
        for (int i = 0; i < classes.size(); i++) {
            Class cls = classes.get(i);
            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + cls.getClassName() + 
                             " (Grade: " + cls.getGradeLevel() + 
                             ") - [REPORT CARDS]");
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 3: User chooses pupil class
     */
    private static void choosePupilClass() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 3: Choose Pupil Class ---");
        
        // Get classes for selected academic year
        List<Class> classes = smosServer.getClassesForAcademicYear(selectedAcademicYear);
        
        // Get user selection with validation
        int choice = 0;
        while (choice < 1 || choice > classes.size()) {
            System.out.print("Enter class number (1-" + classes.size() + "): ");
            try {
                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());
                if (choice < 1 || choice > classes.size()) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");
                }
            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");
            }
        }
        
        selectedClass = classes.get(choice - 1);
        System.out.println("Selected class: " + selectedClass.getClassName());
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 4: System displays list of class students
     */
    private static void displayClassStudents() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 4: Students in " + selectedClass.getClassName() + " ---");
        
        // Get students for selected class
        List<Student> students = smosServer.getStudentsForClass(selectedClass);
        
        if (students.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No students found in this class.");
            System.exit(1);
        }
        
        // Display students
        System.out.println("Students in class:");
        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {
            Student student = students.get(i);
            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + student.getFullName() + 
                             " (ID: " + student.getStudentId() + ")");
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 5: User selects student and four months
     */
    private static void selectStudentAndMonths() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 5: Select Student and Four Months ---");
        
        // Get students for selected class
        List<Student> students = smosServer.getStudentsForClass(selectedClass);
        
        // Select student
        int studentChoice = 0;
        while (studentChoice < 1 || studentChoice > students.size()) {
            System.out.print("Enter student number (1-" + students.size() + "): ");
            try {
                studentChoice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());
                if (studentChoice < 1 || studentChoice > students.size()) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");
                }
            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");
            }
        }
        
        selectedStudent = students.get(studentChoice - 1);
        System.out.println("Selected student: " + selectedStudent.getFullName());
        
        // Select four months
        System.out.println("\nSelect four months for the report:");
        List<String> availableMonths = smosServer.getAvailableMonths(selectedAcademicYear, selectedClass);
        
        if (availableMonths.size() < 4) {
            System.out.println("Warning: Only " + availableMonths.size() + " months available.");
        }
        
        System.out.println("Available months: " + String.join(", ", availableMonths));
        
        selectedMonths.clear();
        for (int i = 0; i < 4 && i < availableMonths.size(); i++) {
            String month;
            do {
                System.out.print("Enter month " + (i + 1) + " (from available months): ");
                month = scanner.nextLine().trim();
                
                if (!availableMonths.contains(month)) {
                    System.out.println("Invalid month. Please choose from available months.");
                } else if (selectedMonths.contains(month)) {
                    System.out.println("Month already selected. Please choose a different month.");
                } else {
                    selectedMonths.add(month);
                    break;
                }
            } while (true);
        }
        
        System.out.println("Selected months: " + String.join(", ", selectedMonths));
    }
    
    /**
     * Step 6: System displays chosen student report for selected four months
     */
    private static void displayStudentReport() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Step 6: Student Report Card ---");
        System.out.println("=====================================");
        
        // Get report card for selected student and months
        ReportCard reportCard = smosServer.getReportCard(selectedStudent, selectedAcademicYear, selectedMonths);
        
        if (reportCard == null) {
            System.out.println("No report card found for the selected criteria.");
            return;
        }
        
        // Display report card
        System.out.println("STUDENT REPORT CARD");
        System.out.println("====================");
        System.out.println("Student: " + reportCard.getStudentName());
        System.out.println("Class: " + reportCard.getClassName());
        System.out.println("Academic Year: " + reportCard.getAcademicYear());
        System.out.println("Report Period: " + String.join(", ", reportCard.getMonths()));
        System.out.println();
        
        System.out.println("ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE");
        System.out.println("--------------------");
        Map<String, String> grades = reportCard.getGrades();
        if (grades.isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("No grades available.");
        } else {
            for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : grades.entrySet()) {
                System.out.println(entry.getKey() + ": " + entry.getValue());
            }
        }
        
        System.out.println();
        System.out.println("ATTENDANCE");
        System.out.println("----------");
        System.out.println("Days Present: " + reportCard.getDaysPresent());
        System.out.println("Days Absent: " + reportCard.getDaysAbsent());
        System.out.println("Attendance Rate: " + reportCard.getAttendanceRate() + "%");
        
        System.out.println();
        System.out.println("TEACHER COMMENTS");
        System.out.println("----------------");
        System.out.println(reportCard.getTeacherComments());
        
        System.out.println();
        System.out.println("OVERALL PERFORMANCE");
        System.out.println("-------------------");
        System.out.println("Overall Grade: " + reportCard.getOverallGrade());
        System.out.println("Status: " + reportCard.getPerformanceStatus());
        
        System.out.println("\n=====================================");
        System.out.println("End of Report Card");
    }
    
    /**
     * Postcondition: Stop connection to SMOS server
     */
    private static void stopSMOSConnection() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Stopping SMOS Server Connection ---");
        if (smosServer != null) {
            smosServer.disconnect();
            System.out.println("Disconnected from SMOS server.");
        }
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing a student
 */
class Student {
    private String studentId;
    private String firstName;
    private String lastName;
    
    public Student(String studentId, String firstName, String lastName) {
        this.studentId = studentId;
        this.firstName = firstName;
        this.lastName = lastName;
    }
    
    public String getStudentId() {
        return studentId;
    }
    
    public String getFirstName() {
        return firstName;
    }
    
    public String getLastName() {
        return lastName;
    }
    
    public String getFullName() {
        return firstName + " " + lastName;
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing a school class
 */
class Class {
    private String classId;
    private String className;
    private int gradeLevel;
    private String teacherName;
    
    public Class(String classId, String className, int gradeLevel, String teacherName) {
        this.classId = classId;
        this.className = className;
        this.gradeLevel = gradeLevel;
        this.teacherName = teacherName;
    }
    
    public String getClassId() {
        return classId;
    }
    
    public String getClassName() {
        return className;
    }
    
    public int getGradeLevel() {
        return gradeLevel;
    }
    
    public String getTeacherName() {
        return teacherName;
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing an academic year
 */
class AcademicYear {
    private String yearId;
    private String startYear;
    private String endYear;
    
    public AcademicYear(String yearId, String startYear, String endYear) {
        this.yearId = yearId;
        this.startYear = startYear;
        this.endYear = endYear;
    }
    
    public String getYearId() {
        return yearId;
    }
    
    public String getStartYear() {
        return startYear;
    }
    
    public String getEndYear() {
        return endYear;
    }
    
    public String getYearRange() {
        return startYear + "-" + endYear;
    }
}

/**
 * Class representing a report card
 */
class ReportCard {
    private String studentName;
    private String className;
    private String academicYear;
    private List<String> months;
    private Map<String, String> grades;
    private int daysPresent;
    private int daysAbsent;
    private String teacherComments;
    private String overallGrade;
    private String performanceStatus;
    
    public ReportCard(String studentName, String className, String academicYear, 
                     List<String> months, Map<String, String> grades,
                     int daysPresent, int daysAbsent, String teacherComments,
                     String overallGrade, String performanceStatus) {
        this.studentName = studentName;
        this.className = className;
        this.academicYear = academicYear;
        this.months = months;
        this.grades = grades;
        this.daysPresent = daysPresent;
        this.daysAbsent = daysAbsent;
        this.teacherComments = teacherComments;
        this.overallGrade = overallGrade;
        this.performanceStatus = performanceStatus;
    }
    
    public String getStudentName() {
        return studentName;
    }
    
    public String getClassName() {
        return className;
    }
    
    public String getAcademicYear() {
        return academicYear;
    }
    
    public List<String> getMonths() {
        return months;
    }
    
    public Map<String, String> getGrades() {
        return grades;
    }
    
    public int getDaysPresent() {
        return daysPresent;
    }
    
    public int getDaysAbsent() {
        return daysAbsent;
    }
    
    public double getAttendanceRate() {
        int totalDays = daysPresent + daysAbsent;
        return totalDays > 0 ? (double) daysPresent / totalDays * 100 : 0;
    }
    
    public String getTeacherComments() {
        return teacherComments;
    }
    
    public String getOverallGrade() {
        return overallGrade;
    }
    
    public String getPerformanceStatus() {
        return performanceStatus;
    }
}

 * Class simulating SMOS server connection and data retrieval

class SMOSServer {
    private boolean connected = false;

    private List<AcademicYear> academicYears;
    private List<Class> classes;
    private List<Student> students;
    private Map<String, ReportCard> reportCards;
    
    public SMOSServer() {
        initializeData();
    }
    
    /**
     * Initialize simulated data
     */
    private void initializeData() {
        // Initialize academic years
        academicYears = new ArrayList<>();
        academicYears.add(new AcademicYear("AY1", "2023", "2024"));
        academicYears.add(new AcademicYear("AY2", "2022", "2023"));
        academicYears.add(new AcademicYear("AY3", "2021", "2022"));

        classes = new ArrayList<>();

        classes.add(new Class("C2", "Class 10B", 10, "Ms. Johnson"));
        classes.add(new Class("C3", "Class 11A", 11, "Dr. Williams"));
        classes.add(new Class("C4", "Class 11B", 11, "Mrs. Brown"));
        classes.add(new Class("C5", "Class 12A", 12, "Mr. Davis"));

        students = new ArrayList<>();
        students.add(new Student("S101", "John", "Doe"));
        students.add(new Student("S102", "Jane", "Smith"));
        students.add(new Student("S103", "Robert", "Johnson"));
        students.add(new Student("S104", "Emily", "Williams"));
        students.add(new Student("S105", "Michael", "Brown"));
        students.add(new Student("S106", "Sarah", "Davis"));
        students.add(new Student("S107", "David", "Miller"));
        students.add(new Student("S108", "Lisa", "Wilson"));
        
        // Initialize report cards
        reportCards = new HashMap<>();
        
        // Sample report card data
        Map<String, String> grades1 = new HashMap<>();
        grades1.put("Mathematics", "A");
        grades1.put("Science", "B+");
        grades1.put("English", "A-");
        grades1.put("History", "B");
        grades1.put("Physical Education", "A");
        
        List<String> months1 = List.of("September", "October", "November", "December");
        
        ReportCard report1 = new ReportCard(
            "John Doe", "Class 10A", "2023-2024",
            months1, grades1,
            85, 5, "John has shown excellent progress in Mathematics and Physical Education. " +
                  "He participates actively in class discussions and completes assignments on time. " +
                  "Could improve focus in Science classes.",
            "A-", "Excellent"
        );

        // More sample data could be added here
    }
    
    /**
     * Connect to SMOS server
     */
    public void connect() {
        connected = true;
    }
    
    /**
     * Disconnect from SMOS server
     */
    public void disconnect() {
        connected = false;
    }

Replace lines from start_line to end_line (inclusive) with the new_content in the open file. All of the new_content will be entered, so makesure your indentation is formatted properly. The new_content must be a complete block of code. Example 1: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to replace line 2 and line 3 edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"new content\\", ) This will replace the second line 2 and line 3 with \\"new content\\". an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. This program simulates an administrator viewing a student\'s report card.\n * It follows the sequence: select academic year -> choose class -> select student and months -> display report.\n */\npublic class ViewOnePage {\n    \n    // Scanner for user input\n    private static Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    \n    // Simulated SMOS server connection\n    private static SMOSServer System.err.println("Error occurred: " + e.getMessage());\n            e.printStackTrace();\n        } finally {\n            // Postcondition: User stops connection to SMOS server\n            stopSMOSConnection();\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 0: Initialize connection to SMOS server\n     */\n    private static void initializeSMOSConnection() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Initializing SMOS Server Connection ---");\n        smosServer = new SMOSServer();\n        smosServer.connect();\n        System.out.println("Connected to SMOS server successfully.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 1: User selects academic year\n     */\n    private static void selectAcademicYear() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select Academic Year ---");\n        \n        // Get available academic years from server\n        List<AcademicYear> academicYears = smosServer.getAvailableAcademicYears();\n        \n        if (academicYears.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No academic years available.");\n            System.exit(1);\n        }\n        \n        // Display available academic years\n        System.out.println("Available Academic Years:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < academicYears.size(); i++) {\n            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + academicYears.get(i).getYearRange());\n        }\n        \n        // Get user selection with validation\n        int choice = 0;\n        while (choice < 1 || choice > academicYears.size()) {\n            System.out.print("Enter your choice (1-" + academicYears.size() + "): ");\n            try {\n                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());\n                if (choice < 1 || choice > academicYears.size()) {\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");\n                }\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        selectedAcademicYear = academicYears.get(choice - 1);\n        System.out.println("Selected academic year: " + selectedAcademicYear.getYearRange());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 2: System displays list of classes with "report cards" button\n     */\n    private static void displayClassesWithReportCards() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Available Classes ---");\n        \n        // Get classes for selected academic year\n        List<Class> classes = smosServer.getClassesForAcademicYear(selectedAcademicYear);\n        \n        if (classes.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No classes available for the selected academic year.");\n            System.exit(1);\n        }\n        \n        // Display classes with "report cards" button indicator\n        System.out.println("Classes with report cards available:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < classes.size(); i++) {\n            Class cls = classes.get(i);\n            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + cls.getClassName() + \n                             " (Grade: " + cls.getGradeLevel() + \n                             ") - [REPORT CARDS]");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 3: User chooses pupil class\n     */\n    private static void choosePupilClass() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 3: Choose Pupil Class ---");\n        \n        // Get classes for selected academic year\n        List<Class> classes = smosServer.getClassesForAcademicYear(selectedAcademicYear);\n        \n        // Get user selection with validation\n        int choice = 0;\n        while (choice < 1 || choice > classes.size()) {\n            System.out.print("Enter class number (1-" + classes.size() + "): ");\n            try {\n                choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());\n                if (choice < 1 || choice > classes.size()) {\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");\n                }\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        selectedClass = classes.get(choice - 1);\n        System.out.println("Selected class: " + selectedClass.getClassName());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 4: System displays list of class students\n     */\n    private static void displayClassStudents() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Students in " + selectedClass.getClassName() + " ---");\n        \n        // Get students for selected class\n        List<Student> students = smosServer.getStudentsForClass(selectedClass);\n        \n        if (students.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No students found in this class.");\n            System.exit(1);\n        }\n        \n        // Display students\n        System.out.println("Students in class:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {\n            Student student = students.get(i);\n            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + student.getFullName() + \n                             " (ID: " + student.getStudentId() + ")");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 5: User selects student and four months\n     */\n    private static void selectStudentAndMonths() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 5: Select Student and Four Months ---");\n        \n        // Get students for selected class\n        List<Student> students = smosServer.getStudentsForClass(selectedClass);\n        \n        // Select student\n        int studentChoice = 0;\n        while (studentChoice < 1 || studentChoice > students.size()) {\n            System.out.print("Enter student number (1-" + students.size() + "): ");\n            try {\n                studentChoice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine());\n                if (studentChoice < 1 || studentChoice > students.size()) {\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please try again.");\n                }\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Please enter a valid number.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        selectedStudent = students.get(studentChoice - 1);\n        System.out.println("Selected student: " + selectedStudent.getFullName());\n        \n        // Select four months\n        System.out.println("\\nSelect four months for the report:");\n        List<String> availableMonths = smosServer.getAvailableMonths(selectedAcademicYear, selectedClass);\n        \n        if (availableMonths.size() < 4) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: Only " + availableMonths.size() + " months available.");\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Available months: " + String.join(", ", availableMonths));\n        \n        selectedMonths.clear();\n        for (int i = 0; i < 4 && i < availableMonths.size(); i++) {\n            String month;\n            do {\n                System.out.print("Enter month " + (i + 1) + " (from available months): ");\n                month = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n                \n                if (!availableMonths.contains(month)) {\n                    System.out.println("Invalid month. Please choose from available months.");\n                } else if (selectedMonths.contains(month)) {\n                    System.out.println("Month already selected. Please choose a different month.");\n                } else {\n                    selectedMonths.add(month);\n                    break;\n                }\n            } while (true);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Selected months: " + String.join(", ", selectedMonths));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 6: System displays chosen student report for selected four months\n     */\n    private static void displayStudentReport() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 6: Student Report Card ---");\n        System.out.println("=====================================");\n        \n        // Get report card for selected student and months\n        ReportCard reportCard = smosServer.getReportCard(selectedStudent, selectedAcademicYear, selectedMonths);\n        \n        if (reportCard == null) {\n            System.out.println("No report card found for the selected criteria.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Display report card\n        System.out.println("STUDENT REPORT CARD");\n        System.out.println("====================");\n        System.out.println("Student: " + reportCard.getStudentName());\n        System.out.println("Class: " + reportCard.getClassName());\n        System.out.println("Academic Year: " + reportCard.getAcademicYear());\n        System.out.println("Report Period: " + String.join(", ", reportCard.getMonths()));\n        System.out.println();\n        \n        System.out.println("ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE");\n        System.out.println("--------------------");\n        Map<String, String> grades = reportCard.getGrades();\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No grades available.");\n        } else {\n            for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : grades.entrySet()) {\n                System.out.println(entry.getKey() + ": " + entry.getValue());\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println();\n        System.out.println("ATTENDANCE");\n        System.out.println("----------");\n        System.out.println("Days Present: " + reportCard.getDaysPresent());\n        System.out.println("Days Absent: " + reportCard.getDaysAbsent());\n        System.out.println("Attendance Rate: " + reportCard.getAttendanceRate() + "%");\n        \n        System.out.println();\n        System.out.println("TEACHER COMMENTS");\n        System.out.println("----------------");\n        System.out.println(reportCard.getTeacherComments());\n        \n        System.out.println();\n        System.out.println("OVERALL PERFORMANCE");\n        System.out.println("-------------------");\n        System.out.println("Overall Grade: " + reportCard.getOverallGrade());\n        System.out.println("Status: " + reportCard.getPerformanceStatus());\n        \n        System.out.println("\\n=====================================");\n        System.out.println("End of Report Card");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Postcondition: Stop connection to SMOS server\n     */\n    private static void stopSMOSConnection() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Stopping SMOS Server Connection ---");\n        if (smosServer != null) {\n            smosServer.disconnect();\n            System.out.println("Disconnected from SMOS server.");\n        }\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * Class representing a student\n */\nclass Student {\n    private String studentId;\n    private String firstName;\n    private String lastName;\n    \n    public Student(String studentId, String firstName, String lastName) {\n        this.studentId = studentId;\n        this.firstName = firstName;\n        this.lastName = lastName;\n    }\n    \n    public String getStudentId() {\n        return studentId;\n    }\n    \n    public String getFirstName() {\n        return firstName;\n    }\n    \n    public String getLastName() {\n        return lastName;\n    }\n    \n    public String getFullName() {\n        return firstName + " " + lastName;\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * Class representing a school class\n */\nclass Class {\n    private String classId;\n    private String className;\n    private int gradeLevel;\n    private String teacherName;\n    \n    public Class(String classId, String className, int gradeLevel, String teacherName) {\n        this.classId = classId;\n        this.className = className;\n        this.gradeLevel = gradeLevel;\n        this.teacherName = teacherName;\n    }\n    \n    public String getClassId() {\n        return classId;\n    }\n    \n    public String getClassName() {\n        return className;\n    }\n    \n    public int getGradeLevel() {\n        return gradeLevel;\n    }\n    \n    public String getTeacherName() {\n        return teacherName;\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * Class representing an academic year\n */\nclass AcademicYear {\n    private String yearId;\n    private String startYear;\n    private String endYear;\n    \n    public AcademicYear(String yearId, String startYear, String endYear) {\n        this.yearId = yearId;\n        this.startYear = startYear;\n        this.endYear = endYear;\n    }\n    \n    public String getYearId() {\n        return yearId;\n    }\n    \n    public String getStartYear() {\n        return startYear;\n    }\n    \n    public String getEndYear() {\n        return endYear;\n    }\n    \n    public String getYearRange() {\n        return startYear + "-" + endYear;\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * Class representing a report card\n */\nclass ReportCard {\n    private String studentName;\n    private String className;\n    private String academicYear;\n    private List<String> months;\n    private Map<String, String> grades;\n    private int daysPresent;\n    private int daysAbsent;\n    private String teacherComments;\n    private String overallGrade;\n    private String performanceStatus;\n    \n    public ReportCard(String studentName, String className, String academicYear, \n                     List<String> months, Map<String, String> grades,\n                     int daysPresent, int daysAbsent, String teacherComments,\n                     String overallGrade, String performanceStatus) {\n        this.studentName = studentName;\n        this.className = className;\n        this.academicYear = academicYear;\n        this.months = months;\n        this.grades = grades;\n        this.daysPresent = daysPresent;\n        this.daysAbsent = daysAbsent;\n        this.teacherComments = teacherComments;\n        this.overallGrade = overallGrade;\n        this.performanceStatus = performanceStatus;\n    }\n    \n    public String getStudentName() {\n        return studentName;\n    }\n    \n    public String getClassName() {\n        return className;\n    }\n    \n    public String getAcademicYear() {\n        return academicYear;\n    }\n    \n    public List<String> getMonths() {\n        return months;\n    }\n    \n    public Map<String, String> getGrades() {\n        return grades;\n    }\n    \n    public int getDaysPresent() {\n        return daysPresent;\n    }\n    \n    public int getDaysAbsent() {\n        return daysAbsent;\n    }\n    \n    public double getAttendanceRate() {\n        int totalDays = daysPresent + daysAbsent;\n        return totalDays > 0 ? (double) daysPresent / totalDays * 100 : 0;\n    }\n    \n    public String getTeacherComments() {\n        return teacherComments;\n    }\n    \n    public String getOverallGrade() {\n        return overallGrade;\n    }\n    \n    public String getPerformanceStatus() {\n        return performanceStatus;\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * Class simulating SMOS server connection and data retrieval\n */\nclass class ViewOnePage {\n    \n    // Scanner for user input\n    private static Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    \n    // Simulated SMOS server connection\n    private static SMOSServer stopSMOSConnection();\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 0: Initialize connection to SMOS server\n     */\n    private static void initializeSMOSConnection() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Initializing SMOS Server Connection ---");\n        smosServer = new SMOSServer();\n        smosServer.connect();\n        System.out.println("Connected to SMOS server successfully.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Step 1: User selects academic year\n     */\n    private static void selectAcademicYear() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select
